name: Power Up Bliss Balls
description: Make ahead, freeze, then grab and go for an easy breakfast.

ingredients.name: nut butter such as natural peanut butter, almond, or nut-free alternative
Power Up Vanilla Protein Blend or Power Up Chocolate Protein Blend

preparation:
1. Remove pits from dates; coarsely chop. Place dates, nut butter, hemp hearts, protein powder, and milk in a food processor. Pulse just until combined and dough is slightly sticky, about 20â€“30 sec.
  2. Portion dough into 12 balls; roll in desired toppings.
  3. Refrigerate up to 5 days or freeze up to 2 months.
tips:
Are you a chocoholic? For an extra fudgy kick, add 1 tbsp cocoa powder when blending.

For easy portioning, use a small ice cream scoop to form balls.

Use soy or almond milk for a dairy-free alternative.
